page.title: 02AGRICULTURE
page.content: MOST OF THE FARMS IN THIS AREA ARE SHEEP FARMS. THE LAND AND THE BUILDINGS USUALLY BELONG TO THE NATIONAL TRUST, AND TENNANT FARMERS RUN THE ESTATES. MANY OF THESE HILL FARMS HAVE THOUSANDS OF ACRES OF MOUNTAIN AND MOORS FOR THE SHEEP TO ROAM ON. IN WINTER TIME THE SHEEP ARE BOUGHT DOWN TO THE FARM TO AVOID THE BAD WEATHER. IN SUMMER THE SHEEP ARE CLIPPED FOR WOOL.THE LAMBING SEASON USUALLY TAKE PLACE IN APRIL OR MAY. AROUND HERE FARMERS HAVE TO BE VERY CAREFUL THAT TOURISTS OR STRAY DOGS DO NOT DISTURB THE THE SHEEP. ONE EXAMPLE OF A SHEEP FARM IS GLENCOYNE FARM JUST TO THE NORTH OF GLENRIDDING. SOME OF THE FARMS SUPPORT A FEW DAIRY COWS AS WELL AS SHEEP AND SO HAY AND SILAGE IS STORED IN JULY FOR WINTER FEED. MANY FARMERS WIVES TAKE IN TOURISTS TO BRING IN EXTRA MONEY.
